summary: This bill mandates a determination and report concerning money laundering and violations of export controls and sanctions within Hong Kong. The Secretary of the Treasury is tasked with determining, within 180 days of enactment, if Hong Kong should be designated as a primary money laundering concern. The Secretary of State, in coordination with the Secretaries of Treasury and Commerce, must then submit a report within 360 days assessing the role of Hong Kong in facilitating transactions that violate U.S. export controls and sanctions, including an evaluation of financial institutions' abilities to prevent such transactions. The report will evaluate several elements related to the National Security Law of Hong Kong.
